keyMoments.title: Arlong's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Arlong makes his dramatic first appearance at Arlong Park, establishing himself as a formidable antagonist who rules the Conomi Islands through terror, corruption, and an ideology of fish-man supremacy.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the primary antagonist of the Arlong Park Arc, one of the most impactful villains in early One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: Shahahaha! Humans are nothing but inferior creatures meant to serve us fish-men!

keyMoments.title: Corrupt Alliance with Marines
keyMoments.description: Arlong is shown bribing Captain Nezumi, revealing the corrupt relationship that has allowed him to operate unchecked.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates how Arlong maintains power through systematic corruption, not just strength.
keyMoments.quote: As always, Captain Nezumi, your cooperation is appreciated. Here is your payment.

bounties.reason: Highest bounty in the East Blue; terrorizing the Conomi Islands

abilities.description: Arlong uses his saw-shaped nose as a weapon to slice through opponents and objects.
As a fish-man, Arlong possesses ten times the physical strength of a normal human and can breathe underwater.

relationships.description: Arlong bribes Captain Nezumi to ensure Marine non-interference with his operations.

evolutionMoments.description: Arlong pays Nezumi bribe money at Arlong Park.

relationships.description: Nami serves as Arlong's cartographer and is revealed to be an officer in his crew.

evolutionMoments.description: Nami appears at Arlong Park as one of Arlong's officers.

relationships.description: Arlong previously worked together with Jinbe, who became one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.

evolutionMoments.description: Yosaku mentions that Arlong used to work with Warlord Jinbe.

reveals.information: Believes fish-men are the superior race and humans are inferior creatures meant to be ruled
Possesses ten times the strength of humans and can breathe underwater as a fish-man
Previously worked with Jinbe, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
Came from the Grand Line, making him far more dangerous than typical East Blue pirates

keyMoments.title: Nojiko's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Nojiko appears in Cocoyasi Village, hinting at deeper connections to Nami and the islands under Arlong's control.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of Nami's adoptive sister, who will be crucial to understanding Nami's backstory.

relationships.description: Nojiko is Nami's adoptive older sister; they were both raised by Bell-mère.

evolutionMoments.description: Nojiko appears in the village where Nami grew up.

reveals.information: Lives in Cocoyasi Village on the Conomi Islands

keyMoments.title: Captain Nezumi's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Captain Nezumi appears accepting bribes from Arlong, revealing his corrupt nature and complicity in Arlong's reign of terror.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the corrupt Marine who enables Arlong's operations and later becomes responsible for Luffy's first bounty.

keyMoments.title: Corrupt Alliance with Arlong
keyMoments.description: Nezumi's corrupt relationship with Arlong is revealed as he accepts bribe money.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the systemic corruption that allows Arlong to operate unchecked.

relationships.description: Nezumi accepts bribes from Arlong to ignore his criminal activities in the Conomi Islands.

evolutionMoments.description: Nezumi receives bribe money from Arlong at Arlong Park.

reveals.information: Accepts bribes from Arlong to turn a blind eye to his criminal activities
Captain of the Marines' 16th Branch in the East Blue

keyMoments.title: Kuroobi Introduction
keyMoments.description: Kuroobi, a ray fish-man and officer of the Arlong Pirates, makes his first appearance at Arlong Park.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of one of Arlong's three main officers who will later fight the Straw Hats.

abilities.description: Kuroobi is a master of Fish-Man Karate, a martial art that utilizes water.

relationships.description: Kuroobi serves as one of Arlong's three main officers.

evolutionMoments.description: Kuroobi is shown as an officer at Arlong Park.

reveals.information: Officer in the Arlong Pirates and master of Fish-Man Karate

keyMoments.title: Chew Introduction
keyMoments.description: Chew, a smelt-whiting fish-man and officer of the Arlong Pirates, makes his first appearance at Arlong Park.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of one of Arlong's three main officers.

abilities.description: Chew can store large amounts of water in his mouth and shoot high-pressure water bullets.

relationships.description: Chew serves as one of Arlong's three main officers.

evolutionMoments.description: Chew is shown as an officer at Arlong Park.

reveals.information: Officer in the Arlong Pirates with water-shooting abilities

keyMoments.title: Hatchan Introduction
keyMoments.description: Hatchan, an octopus fish-man and officer of the Arlong Pirates, makes his first appearance at Arlong Park.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of one of Arlong's officers who later becomes a recurring ally to the Straw Hats.

abilities.description: Hatchan can wield six swords simultaneously using his six octopus arms.

relationships.description: Hatchan serves as one of Arlong's three main officers.

evolutionMoments.description: Hatchan is shown as an officer at Arlong Park.

reveals.information: Officer in the Arlong Pirates with six-sword fighting style

keyMoments.title: Chabo's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Chabo, a young boy from the destroyed Gosa Village, appears harboring hatred for Arlong who killed his father.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the innocent victims of Arlong's tyranny and the generational trauma it causes.

relationships.description: Chabo's father was killed by Arlong during the destruction of Gosa Village.

evolutionMoments.description: Chabo harbors hatred for Arlong who destroyed his village and killed his father.

reveals.information: Father was killed by Arlong during the destruction of Gosa Village

keyMoments.title: Nami Revealed as Arlong's Officer
keyMoments.description: Nami appears at Arlong Park and reveals herself to be an officer in the Arlong Pirates, claiming she has been using the Straw Hats from the start.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most shocking moments in early One Piece, this apparent betrayal drives the emotional core of the arc and sets up Nami's tragic backstory reveal.
keyMoments.quote: I am an officer of the Arlong Pirates. I've been using you from the start.

relationships.description: Nami is revealed to serve as an officer and cartographer for Arlong.

evolutionMoments.description: Nami's position as an Arlong Pirates officer is revealed.

relationships.description: Nami confronts the captured Zoro, claiming she used the Straw Hats.

evolutionMoments.description: Nami coldly tells Zoro she has been using the crew all along.

reveals.information: Serves as an officer and cartographer for the Arlong Pirates
Claims to have been using the Straw Hats from the beginning

keyMoments.title: Zoro Captured by Arlong Pirates
keyMoments.description: Zoro is captured by the Arlong Pirates after being abandoned by Johnny and Usopp, and is interrogated by Arlong about fish-man supremacy.
keyMoments.significance: Places Zoro in a vulnerable position and sets up the confrontation with Nami.

keyMoments.title: Confronted by Nami's Betrayal
keyMoments.description: Zoro faces the shocking revelation that Nami is an officer of the Arlong Pirates and claims to have been using the crew.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's loyalty despite the apparent betrayal.

keyMoments.title: Explains the Seven Warlords System
keyMoments.description: Yosaku provides crucial exposition about the Seven Warlords of the Sea, establishing this major power structure in the One Piece world.
keyMoments.significance: First detailed explanation of the Shichibukai system.
keyMoments.quote: The Seven Warlords of the Sea... they're seven pirates who've been given special rights by the World Government!

keyMoments.title: First Mentions Jinbe
keyMoments.description: Yosaku mentions Jinbe by name for the first time, revealing his connection to Arlong.
keyMoments.significance: First mention of a character who won't appear for 399 more episodes.
keyMoments.quote: Arlong used to work together with Jinbe, one of the Seven Warlords!
